mechanoreception.notes: As echinoderms, Kamptosomatidae likely possess mechanoreceptors for detecting touch and water currents. This is inferred due to the general body plan and lifestyle of echinoderms.

chemoreception.notes: Echinoderms typically use chemoreception to locate food and potential mates. This is inferred due to the general feeding strategies and behaviors observed in other echinoderms.

photoreception.notes: Presence and capabilities of photoreceptors is currently unknown.
